description: Prehistoric people in inflatable rafts on a river are annoyed by approaching neighbors in another raft. The humor stems from the absurd juxtaposition of primitive characters using modern recreational equipment and complaining about a mundane, suburban-style problem like neighbors borrowing something, especially water in an environment where it is abundant. The situation highlights the timeless nature of petty social annoyances, transplanted into an anachronistic setting.
caption: “Gad! Here come those pesky Andersons again ... probably want to borrow a cup of water.”
